column1: 0301|about three o'clock|It was now about three o'clock in the morning and Francis Macomber
column2: who had been asleep a little while after he had stopped thinking about the lion

column1: 0301|past three o’clock|I’m not going to just lie here
column3: and let my life be ruined! And when she heard
column5: my masters! Past three o’clock and a fair morning!” she flung back the covers and got out of bed
